loans.use: To buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and supports four people. Maria has run a small-scale dairy farming business for the last seven years with a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is borrowing KES 10,000 with which she intends to purchase animal feeds as well as some farm input i.e fertilizers for this years’ planting season. She plans to use the additional income to re-invest back into the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her grand children.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Las Flores es  un grupo integrado por 6 personas cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica con el propósito de día a día brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida: Angela vende calzado, Maria de los Angeles vende refrescos, Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, Karla venta de calzado, Margarita venta de refrescos e Irma a la venta de abarrotes. 

Doña Margarita es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, ella tiene dos hijos, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Roberto. Ella platica que siempre había querido tener una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar  y hace 5 meses con el apoyo de su esposo puso su tiendita en la cual vende variedad de abarrotes dulces y refrescos. Doña Margarita abre su negocio todos los días desde muy temprano para que sus vecinos acudan a comprar, lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es que sus hijos están aprendiendo a trabajar ya que de ves en cuando la ayudan a despachar. 

Un crédito de Vision Fund le dará la oportunidad de resurtir su negocio comprando, frijol, aceite, arroz, sopa, azúcar, papel higiénico, aluminio, pasta dental, shampoo, galletas y refrescos. Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continué creciendo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y en un futuro dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiando. 

Nota: la señora del fondo de blusa y pantalón negro no es miembro del grupo pero quiso salir en la foto.
texts.en:
Las Flores is a group made up of 6 people, each of whom has a economic trade with the aim of offering their family a better life on a day to day basis. Angela sells shows, Maria de los Angeles sells drinks, Maria Luisa sells cosmetics, Karla sells shoes, Margarita sells drinks and Irma sells groceries.

Margarita is a happy and enterprising woman who has two children, she only studied a primary school education and is married to Roberto. She tells us that she always wanted to have a grocery shop in her home to be able to help with the household expenses. Five months ago, with the help of her husband, she was able to set up a little shop where she sells various groceries, sweets and drinks. Margarita opens her business early every day to welcome her neighbours. Her favourite thing about her business is that her children are learning to work as they occasionally help in the store.

A loan from Vision Fund will help her to restock her business by buying beans, oil, rice, soup, sugar, toilet paper, tin foil, tooth paste, shampoo, biscuits and drinks. She hopes that with this investment her business can continue growing and offering a better service to her customers and in the future she will be able to give her children the opportunity to continue with their studies.

NB. the woman in the background wearing the blouse and black trousers is not a group member, but she wanted to be in the photo.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, rice, soup, sugar, toilet paper, tin foil, toothpaste, shampoo, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 58-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven grown children. She has been running a sari-sari store, or variety store, for 12 years now. She sells a variety of foods, snacks, and drinks and earns 4,000 PHP per month. 

Nida is requesting a loan to buy items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, and snack foods. Through this loan, she will be able to increase her stock.

In the future, Nida hopes to expand her business and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy  items like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, food snacks

loans.name: Boli

texts.en:
Mrs. Boli is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger in Dornogobi province of Mongolia. Her husband Tumenjargal, aged 57 runs a taxi service in town. Her older children have got married and live separately. Her daughters Oyundelger, aged 20 and Odontuya, aged 18 both are university students. 

The borrower has been running an organic vegetable growing and sales business for years and she is well experienced in the field. She also give suggestions and mentors newly started businesses. She is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase seeds and soils to prepare for the plantation period in spring. She is a hardworking, helpful and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils to prepare for plantation period in spring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fuel wood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tserensevjid

texts.en:
Mr. Tserensevjid is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Tserenlham, aged 25, is a university student. His daughter Enhjin, aged 2, goes to the local kindergarten. The borrower's parents have been running a cobbler business for years and the borrower used to help them to run their business. 

Since he got married to his wife, he lives separately from his parents. So he is now planning to start his own business, providing cobbler services at home. He is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and tools for his newly started business. He is well-experienced, hardworking and an enthusiastic young man.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and tools for his newly started business.

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es: Luis compró muchos insumos con los que surtió su peluquería ubicada en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, un secador profesional y una plancha. Ahora tiene mas clientes, pues con  secador nuevo y plancha ofrece a su clientela un trabajo con mayor calidad y en condiciones satisfactorias para él, porque antes atendia solo a hombres y la clientela de mujers es muy buena y obtiene mas ingresos. El dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: "Gracias, por aportar un granito de arena para que mis metas se esten cumpliendo, para algun dia tener una peluquería gigante. " En la actualidad se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar nuevamente a un credikiva, porque quiewre seguir creciendo de su mano. Con este finaciamiento comprará maquinas nuevas para motilar y para la afeitada, reemplazando así, las ya obsoletas que estaba usando y con ello impactar una vez mas a su clientela y hacerla muy fiel.
texts.en: Luis bought many supplies such as a professional hairdryer and a flattening iron with which he stocked up his hair salon located in the town of Cartagena de India. He currently has more customers, because with the new hairdryer and flattening iron he offers his clientele a higher quality work. These conditions are satisfactory for him because he used to serve only male customers, and the female clientele is very good and results in better profits. He tells his Kiva lenders: "Thank you for contributing a grain of sand towards the accomplishment of my goals, so that someday I may own a huge salon". He has recently approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to apply for a new Kiva loan, because he wishes to keep on growing through his own efforts. With this loan he'll purchase new machines for trimming and shaving hair in order to replace the old ones that he's been using. That way he'll once again make an impact on his customers and keep them very loyal.

loans.use: to purchase new machines for trimming and shaving hair.

loans.name: Dora Clemencia

texts.es: Dora  de 52 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, histórica y hermosa ciudad en la Región Caribe Colombiana. Allí conformó su hogar y habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 18 a 22 años. Ella ofrece en un punto de atención, el servicio de mejoramiento de la imagen personal; es su sala de bellezas realiza cortes de cabello, tratamientos capilares, peinados, a damas, caballeros y a jóvenes principalmente;  así mismo vende mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos, con la cual promociona perfumes, cremas, artículos de aseo, tintes, etc, mediante asesoría que da a su clientela, para potencializar su compra. Su día laboral inicia desde las 6 de la mañana y terminas solo hasta las 9 de la noche,   de lunes a domingos, y todo este esfuerzo es motivado por el mejoramiento del bienestar de su familia y el suyo propio. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos capilares, insumos de peluquería, cremas y colonias. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado, a una clientela, que ella misma ha construido desde que inició su negocio hace 10 años. En la actualidad su principal meta es apoyar a sus hijos, para que logren completar sus estudios universitarios y mas adelante tener un local propio y estos son sus principales desafíos de vida.
texts.en:
Dora, 52, lives in the city of Cartagena, a historic and beautiful city in the Caribe region of Columbia. She set up her home there and lives with her partner and their two children, aged 18 and 22. She runs a beauty salon, which primarily offers haircuts and treatments to ladies, gentlemen and young people. She also sells products from specialist magazines and promotes perfumes, lotions, toiletries, dyes etc. which she recommends to her customers to complement their purchase.

Her working day starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 9 in the evening, Monday to Sunday. All her effort is motivated by a desire to improve the well being of herself and her family.

She is applying for this loan, the first loan that she has had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy hair products, hair dressing supplies, creams and lotions. Her sales are made on a credit and cash basis to a customer base that she has built up since she started her business 10 years ago. Her current goal is to support her children so that they can study at university and in the future she would like to have her own store, these are her main challenges in life.

loans.use: to buy hair products, hairdressing supplies, creams and lotions.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 53 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cleofe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cleofe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

Cleofe has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Cleofe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es: Edgar de 39 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 1 y 12 años, en Galapa, lugar conocido como un municipio artesano creador de canastos y mascaras , además de tener una gran poblacion ganadera, y en la actualidad se están llevando a cabo,  la construcción de zonas industriales a gran escala y se realiza uno de los mejores carnavales municipales, que en esta temporada  potencializa el negocio de Edgar, quien vende de comidas rápidas en un punto estratégico, en el cual desde hace 3 años ha logrado mantener buenos precios y un stock con el que inicia cada día su oferta. Antes de iniciar su negocio era administrador de un negocio igual en la ciudad de Barranquilla, poco a poco reunió dinero y tuvo la oportunidad de aprovechar su experiencia y emprender su propio generador de ingresos, hoy en el municipio de Galapa lo conocen por los deliciosos perros calientes, hamburguesas, pizza y salchipapas que elabora con las mejores salsas que él mismo prepara. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual aumentara el volumen de sus compras en insumos como panes, salsa de tomate, mayonesa, mostaza   obteniendo mejores descuentos en una época donde las ventas se incrementan para dar respuesta a los carnavales y esto es lo que hace que esta inversión sea oportuna y tenga mucho éxito. Su meta más adelante  es comprar un local y adquirir un nuevo puesto de trabajo,  que genere nuevos ingresos y mayor posicionamiento en la plaza.
texts.en:
39-year-old Edgar lives with his wife and his two children, who are 1 and 12 years old, in Galapa; a place known as a creative town for craftsmen of baskets and masks, in addition to having a large rancher population.  Currently, they are carrying out large scale construction in the industrial areas and it is the location for one of the greatest town fairs, which at the moment encourages Edgar who sells fast food at a strategic spot where for three years he has managed to maintain good prices and stock with which he makes his offering each day.  Before starting his own business he was an administrator in a similar business in the city of Barranquilla.  Little by little he raised money and had the opportunity to take advantage of his experience and begin his own generator of income.  Today, he is known in the town of Galapa for delicious hotdogs, hamburgers, pizza, and salchipapas (a kind of kebab) that he makes with the best sauces, which he prepares himself.  

Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will increase the size of his purchases of supplies like bread, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, and mustard, getting him better discounts at a time when sales increase in response to the carnivals.  This is what makes sure the investment will be opportune and very successful.  His larger goal is to buy a restaurant space and acquire a new position that will generate new income and greater reputation in the plaza.

loans.use: to buy supplies like bread, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, and mustard.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce  sells cement at Ankyeryim near Takoradi which she has done for 20 years. She is married with seven dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Joyce will use her loan to purchase more bags of cement to sell. With the new profit she will expand her cement business.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of cement to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is an active person who enjoys the retail trade. For several years, she has been selling firewood, a business she still does to date. This business and the previous loan have provided her with reasonable results. Luvuno wants to expand this business but she does not have enough working capital to do this. It is for this business that she is asking for this loan to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

Luvuno strives to provide for the welfare of her family and to maintain the inventory of her business. She is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her through this loan.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 50 years old and married with four children. Merlyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional carabao.

Merlyn has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional carabao.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 30 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Connie has a business selling native bags in the Philippines. Connie requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more native bags to sell to her customers.

Connie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Connie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more native bags to sell.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt is 43 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Ganshur, aged 40, runs a small clothing retail business from a rental counter in the local market. His son Monhbayar, aged 11, goes to a local school. 

The borrower started his organic fruit retail business from a rental counter of a local food market in September 2012. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase large amount of organic fruits to sell to local customers during winter and spring. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic fruits to sell to local customers during winter and spring.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 17-year-old daughter, she is engaged in a retail store business. She sells soft drinks, coconut wine and basic commodities like sugar, coffee and seasonings. She has been in the retail business for two years. 

Rosita requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries. In the future, Rosita would like to invest in other ventures to support her family as well as to send her daughter to college.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities to sell like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Mr. Gantulga is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in small house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Orhontsetseg, aged 34, helps her husband to run his business: a butcher shop. His daughters Badamlyanhua, aged 13, Angirmaa, aged 11 and Monhsuvd, aged 6 go to local schools. 

The borrower has been running his butcher shop business since 2009. He purchases meat from herders in the countryside and sells to local customers from his rental counter at the local market. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to reduce his transportation cost in order to increase his profit. He and his wife both are hardworking, responsible and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly vehicle to reduce his transportation costs in order to increase his profits.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 63-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five grown children. She engages in a business buying and selling shells and empty bottles. She buys and at the same time sells empty bottles. She has been in this business for 17 years now. She usually earns 3,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income. 

Antonia is requesting a loan to buy shells, empty bottles and aluminum. Through this loan, she will be able to buy and sell. In the future, Antonia hopes to expand her business. She wants to build her own junk shop.

loans.use: to buy shells, empty bottles and aluminum.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es: El grupo Jazmin esta conformado por quince integrantes todas son mujeres muy responsables pero ante todo mujeres muy trabajadoras es un grupo muy armonioso saben resolver dificultades facilmente entre ellas mantienen una amistad que las identifica de otros grupos, El nombre del grupo lo elijieron ellas mismas porque les gusto no sabe si influyo porque una de las integrantes tiene este nombre o por otra razon, Maura quin forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 38 años de edad es mama soltera de tres niños que se encuentran estuidiando, La señora Maura se dedica a la venta lenceria esta vez esta solicitando un credito para comprar sus prendas como brasier, pantaletas, mayones, entre otras cosas en la actividad lleva ya cinco años platica que inicio su actividad porque anteriormente le ayudaba a una amiga a vender pero vio que era un buen negocio por lo que decidio iniciar ella independientemente, cuenta que le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas siempre trata lo mejor posible a su clientas, platica que lo mas chistoso de su trabajo es venderle ropa intima a los cabaleros ya que ellos es mas dificil de tenerlos contentos porque a unos no les gusta la tela, los colores, los estilos, tipos y a otros pues si es muy dificil convencer a los caballeros que le compren por eso casi no venden ropa intima para caballero, Maura comento "Me gusta mucho mi actividad porque gracias a la venta de ropa intima he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos que se encuentran estudiando ya que para mi ellos son mi pilares para seguir adelante, aunque luego hay clientes que se tardan en pagar pero siempre pagan tarde pero seguro" Doña Maura anteriormente solo vendia por catalogo pero penso que obtendria mas gannacias si pudiera vender varios tipos de ropa y atraer mas clientas situacion que le ha favorecido muy bien todas las tardes Doña Maura recorre las calles de su comunidad y de otras comunidades para ofrecer sus prendas, una de las metas de Doña Maura es que sus hijos puedan realizarse profesionalmente para que ellos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las otras integrantes son Florentina quien comprara maiz para tortillas, Margarita quien invertira en su taller de costura, Maribel, Beatriz y Mirna invertiran en ropa para su venta,  Doña Alicia invertira en su casa para materiales, Lizbeth C., Jazmin, Laura y Antonia invertiran en pollos y guajolotes para cria y su venta, Doña Elena, Lizberth S. y Rosalía invertiran en sus borregos para cria y venta y finalmente Leticia comprara tela para la elaboracion de cortinas para su venta. Todas ellas estan muy agradecidas con Vision Found y KIVA por el credito otorgado ya que sera de gran apoyo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Jazmin group is made up of 15 members who are all responsible and, above all, hard-working women. It is a very friendly group that knows how to solve problems easily between themselves. They have a strong friendship which makes them different from other groups. They chose the name for the group themselves because they liked it; they’re not sure if the fact that one of the members is called Jazmin influenced them or if it was something else. 

Maura is a member of the group and is 38 years old. She is the single mother of three children who are all in school. Maura sells underwear and is requesting a loan so that she can buy items such as bras, panties, tights, among other items. She has been running her business for five years and started the business  because she was helping a  friend with her underwear business and saw that it made money. That’s why she decided to set up a business of her own. She has made good sales and she always tries to treat her customers well. She says that the funniest thing about her job is selling underwear to men because they are very difficult to please. They either don’t like the material, the color, or the styles, and it’s very difficult to convince them to buy things, and that’s why she hardly ever sells to men. Maura says, "I like my job a lot because thanks to selling underwear, I have been able to provide for my children who are in school and for me they are my motivation to keep going. Some customers take a while to pay me but they always pay in the end." Maura used to sell by catalog but realized that she could make more money selling a variety of clothing to attract more customers, which has worked well for her. 

Every afternoon Maura passes through the streets of her community and other communities selling clothing. One of Maura’s goals is for her children to be able to achieve their professional dreams so that they have a better quality of life. The other members of the group are Florentina, who will buy corn to make tortillas, Margarita who will invest in her dressmaking workshop, Maribel, Beatriz,  and Miran will invest in clothes to sell, Alicia will buy materials to improve her house, Lizbeth C, Jazmin, Laura and Antonia will buy chickens and turkeys to raise and sell, Elena, Lizbeth S. and Rosalia will invest in sheep to raise and sell, finally Leticia will buy fabric to make curtains to sell.
They are all very grateful to Vision Found and Kiva for the loan which will be a great help for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery stock, e.g., tomatoes, onions, potatoes, kale etc.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtsetseg is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her husband Altansuh, aged 32, works at a local fire department. Her children Monhbileg, aged 8 goes to a local primary school and Monhmandah, aged 3 goes to a local kindergarten. 

The borrower has been working as a saleswoman for years in the local market. She has gained a lot of experience and now she is starting her own business of clothing sales based on her experience and network. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory from Erlian, China for her newly started business. She is a hardworking, diligent and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from Erlian, China for her newly started business.

loans.name: Osman Adilson

texts.es:
Osman, necesita un nuevo préstamo porque quiere invertir nuevamente en el cultivo de granos básicos, se comprará abono y herbicidas, para poder realizar la siembra de maíz y pipian, esto le ayudará para que realice como siempre su trabajo del cual obtiene lo necesario para su familia.

Considera que el crédito Le permitió tener una mejor producción en la siembra, con esto ha podido obtener lo necesario en alimentación y vestuario para su la economía en su hogar está bastante estable, todos gocen de salud y se mantiene el grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Osman is requesting a new loan because he wants to invest again in growing basic grains.  He will buy fertilizer and herbicides in order to sow corn and pipián (a type of squash).  This will help him carry on his daily work, from which he supports the needs of his family.

Osman says that his previous loan allowed him to have a better yield from his planting.  With this he has been able to meet his family’s food and clothing needs.  He says that his household finances are now relatively stable and he is able to support his family, who are all healthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like eggs, sugar, beverages, seasonings and soaps. She has been in the sari-sari business for two years. Her husband is a farmer.

Due to a lack of capital, Monalisa requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like eggs, sugar, noodles and biscuits. In the future, Monalisa would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like eggs, sugar, noodles and biscuits.

loans.name: Laurencio

texts.en:
Laurencio is a 34-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. He has been engaged in the fishing business for six years now. His monthly income is 4000 PHP. This is the source of his income. 

Laurencio is requesting a loan to buy fish net, fish hooks, and floaters. These materials are used in fishing. Using the loan, he will be able to catch many fish to sell in his community.

In the future, Laurencio hopes to expand his business. He also wants his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fish net, fish hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a barber chair and a hair trimming machine.

loans.name: Ratinoi

texts.en:
Ratinoi is 28 years old. She is married to Parken, a businessman,and they have three children aged between eight and two years. She is a farmer, farming her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last five years.

She learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET Ltd. This will be her second loan after paying back the previous loans successfully. She has now joined a group of other farmers who are undertaking a group project of fattening livestock.

Her dream is do large-scale farming and have her own farm machinery.  She is a painstaking lady who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mejorar el negocio, comprando variedad de ropa, blusas, faldas, lociones en variedad de fragancias, esto ayudara a que Ana continúe trabajando y con el negocio este en mejores condiciones.

Con el préstamo anterior ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo, que le permitió trabajar y proveer a su familia lo necesario, su negocio conto con mercadería, sus condiciones en la familia han sido estables.
texts.en:
Ana is applying for a loan because she needs to improve her business. She will buy a variety of clothing, such as shirts and skirts, as well as lotions in a variety of fragrances. This will help her to continue working, as her business will be in a better condition.

Her previous loan has proven to have a positive effect. It allowed her to work and provide necessities for her family. Her business is stocked with merchandise and her family is in a stable condition.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, such as shirts and skirts, as well as lotions.

loans.name: Makadara A Group

texts.en:
Lydiah’s group has 11 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Lydiah is pictured on the right of Makadara A Group with her hand raised. Lydiah is shown with the 4 men and 7 women of her group. Her loan amount will enable her to plant half an acre with sorghum and maize. Lydiah first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lydiah joined One Acre Fund to get access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and also to improve her farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Before joining One Acre Fund, Lydiah could only harvest 1.5 bags of maize per half acre, but now she is able to harvest 3.5 bags! She plans to use future profits from the harvest to send her children to school, and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs (such as seed and fertilizer) on credit. Lydiah’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit in total.

Please note: Catherine, a member of Samoya Bidii Group, is also pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not be receiving funding from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Briseyda Alexandra

texts.es:
Briseyda, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene un niño de 6 años de edad, vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana para ayudar a su familia con los gastos, aprendió este trabajo con su madre, tiene un año de vender aparte, trabajando de lunes a sábado.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, pantalones, calcetines, shorts, entre otra variedad, esto le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, aumentar las posibilidades de ingresos.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, sus condiciones económicas en la familia, a través del trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
28-year old Briseyda lives with her husband who has a 6-year old son. He lives with his mother. Briseyda sells American clothing to help pay for household expenses. She learned this work from her mother and has worked on her own for the past year. She works from Monday to Saturday.

Briseyda is seeking a loan to buy blouses, pants, socks, shorts and other items. The loan will help strengthen her business and increase earnings. Her goal is to improve her business and the economic status of her family through her work.

loans.use: buy blouses, pants, socks, and shorts

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Mr. Banzragch is 25 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a 'ger' in Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife Oyundelger is 30 years old and stays home taking care of their daughter Bayarmaa, age 3. 

The borrower has been working with his brother-in-law since 2006. He and his brother-in-law purchase animal pelts and other primary materials from herders in the countryside. He is now requesting 2,085,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce their transportation costs when purchasing animal pelts from herders. Mr. Banzragch is hardworking, well-behaved and an honest man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car for transporting animal pelts purchased from herders

loans.name: Rosvilla

texts.en:
Rosvilla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling coconuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

NWTF is presenting Rosvilla's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Deisy Lorena

texts.es:
Deisy, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar más mercadería en variedad, comprándose paletas, bonos, sombrita, sorbetes de diferentes sabores, entre otra variedad de helados que existen y que son del gusto de los clientes.

Ella considera que el efecto que ha tenido como la utilidad de los préstamos es un negocio más estable y con mayor variedad para los clientes, es quien le aprobé lo necesario para su familia que hasta el momento se han mantenido estables económicamente y en salud.
texts.en:
Deisy has decided to apply for a new loan in order to buy a variety of merchandise. She will buy popsicles, cones, paper umbrellas, and various flavors of sorbet, along with a range of the types of ice cream which her clients enjoy.

She believes that the effect of the loans has been to make her business more stable, with a greater variety for her clients. She is able to provide necessities for her family, and so far they have maintained stability both in their financial situation and their health.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, cones, paper umbrellas, and different flavors of sorbet.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for five years. She has been a casual worker and it's from this that she obtained capital to start the cafe.

Jumwa was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, cooking utensils, etc.

Jumwa believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children and also use the money to open a larger cafe or a restaurant in future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is 22 years old, and lives in the village of Agarakavan with his parents and three brothers. He studies at the Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture, in the department of adaptive physical culture. He also works at local school as a teacher of physical culture. 

The whole family works hard to sustain their living and cover their basic needs. It is very hard for Gevorg to save money for his education, so he has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition. The loan will enable him to complete the education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 51 years old and blessed with three children between 10 and 20 years old. A livestock trader in Narok for the past six years, he earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

Moses has requested his second loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His dreams are to grow the business to a large scale and improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Kimugui B Group

texts.en:
Agnes' group, Kimugui B Group, consisting of 12 farmers, is located in Bungoma South District. Agnes is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She will receive input loans for planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize.

Agnes joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could rest assured of reliable input delivery and access to the best input prices.

Agnes reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about four bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 11 bags per 1/2 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to improve her family’s living standard and donate some bags to the orphans.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Agnes’ group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mechimeru B Group

texts.en:
Julliet, pictured on the right with her hand raised, belongs to the 10-member Mechimeru B Group in Bungoma South District. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Julliet, a new One Acre Fund farmer, is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Julliet described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and invest in another business.

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Julliet’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for two years. 

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Henry is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy retail stock, e.g., rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Makadara B Group

texts.en:
Makadara B is a group of 14 farmers in Bungoma South District represented by Jamila.  The group has 11 women and 3 men. Jamila is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Jamila’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send her children to school.


Jamila managed to harvest 0.75 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Jamila’s group will receive 7 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Namulungu Group

texts.en:
Milton is a member of Namulungu Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with 12 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 5 men. Milton is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Milton is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund so he can generate increased profits, to send his children to school and grow enough food for the family.

Milton says that last year his harvest was good. However, he hopes that he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season to send his children to school, and invest in another business. Milton‘s group members will take input loans of half an acre each, so in total this group will receive input loans for 6 acres of land. 

Please note: Nelly, a member of Samoya Bidii Group, is pictured above. However, her husband has already appeared on Kiva and she shares her OAF membership with him. In order to prevent the double funding of a farmer, she is pictured as a member of the group, but will not receive funding from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mufule Group

texts.en:
Patrick is pictured on the right with his hand raised, amongst his Mufule Group members. There are five women and five men in the group, and they are all farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs, such as seed and fertilizer, will be delivered to him on credit to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Patrick first enrolled with One Acre Fund (OAF) during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Patrick joined OAF to improve his farming techniques with their methods, and to access the best input prices.

Patrick says that before One Acre Fund he was able to grow about 3/4 bag of maize per half acre, but with his OAF loan during Long Rains 2012, he managed to harvest 9 bags per half acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school, and perhaps invest in a goat. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit, so Patrick‘s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs in total.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kimugui D Group

texts.en:
Hudson is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Kimugui D Group members. The 15 of them, 9 women and 6 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs, such as seed and fertilizer, will be delivered to him on credit to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Hudson joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2008, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Hudson joined One Acre Fund to improve his farming techniques, so he could generate increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Hudson was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 10 bags per half acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to invest in livestock, and perhaps invest in another business. Hudson’s group members will each receive input loans for half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season, so in total they will receive inputs for 7.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is 35 years old, and blessed with seven children. He is a livestock trader in Narok, Kenya and has been running his business for the past seven years making a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to join a group of other farmers to purchase more livestock for livestock fattening and resale at a gain. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dreams is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mabuusi Group

texts.en:
Alice’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Alice is pictured on the right of Mabuusi Group with her hand raised. Alice is pictured amongst the one man and nine women of her group. She will receive loans to enable the planting of ½ an acre with sorghum and maize. Alice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer as well as to improve her farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 9 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Alice’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos de ocho años y de dos años y medio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para suplir las necesidades del hogar, realiza la venta de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, luego se dedica a realizar las labores del hogar, ella quiere tener más inventario porque los clientes les demandan ropa.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa para damas y para niños, blusas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, trajes, con esto podrá tener una mejor disponibilidad y aumentar así la variedad para los clientes.

Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos crezcan sanos y darle el estudio hasta que ellos se superen, en el área del negocio que quiere aumentar con mercadería nueva.
texts.en:
Juana makes a living selling clothes. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children, ages two-and-a-half and eight. She sells clothes in order to cover her household necessities. She works from 7 a.m. until 2 p.m. Afterwards, she does housework. She would like to have more inventory because her clients are ordering clothes from her.

She has applied for a loan to buy clothing for women and children, such as shirts, skirts, dresses, pants, and suits. She will then be able to provide greater availability and increased variety for her clients.

One of her dreams is for her children to grow up healthy and to provide them with an education until they excel. In terms of her business, she would like to expand with new merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, pants, and suits.

loans.name: Mechimeru A Group

texts.en:
Meltus is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Mechimeru A Group members. The ten of them, five women and five men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Meltus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Meltus joined One Acre Fund in order to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods and access the best input prices.


Meltus reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 9.5 bags per 1/2 acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Meltus‘ group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: 010327Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Định  operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish sauce. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

Định  is 22 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 010327Bắc Sơn - Hoằng Phụ  solidarity group. 
Định  supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  This is Định's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Định  has been involved in this business for four years.  The main hardship that Định  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Định  hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish for making fish sauce.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 39-year-old married man and father of three children.  He has been working as a blacksmith for 13 years. In 2000, he opened his current shop to improve his living and increase his income.  Hasan is applying for his third loan cycle from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary aluminum for his business to make sure that he will respond easily to his customers' needs.

Hasan has a good pay-back history, with a very good reputation. He hopes to keep improving and developing his business to make sure that he can provide his family the best education and living.

loans.use: To buy necessary aluminum for his business

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold, 31 years old, lives with his mother and two brothers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. His mother retired from work in 2006, and his brother teaches at a kindergarten. He himself has been working as chief of a construction team since 2008. 

At this time, the price of construction materials is at its lowest level, and he wants to use this opportunity to build his own house. So, he is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, gypsum and planks. As a result, he can begin his house building work in the beginning of spring.  

The house will provide the family with a comfortable and warm environment. Also, the family will burn less coal due to their heat conserving future house. This is especially helpful to efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and planks.

loans.name: Topoika

texts.en:
Topoika is 43 years old and has four children. He is a livestock trader, which he has been doing for six years.  He earns 20,000 KES a month.

Topoika is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more livestock to sell. The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business.   In the future, he hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 40 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. He also has two additional dependents at home. He is from Kulanda town Bo.  

Alfred runs a jewelry and cosmetics shop, where he sells earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and different kinds of cream, which he has been doing for 10 years.  He works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. He is also an agriculturist, raising crops and selling them.  

Alfred is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more jewelry and cosmetics to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow him to buy a plot of land and increase his capital.  In the future, he plans to become a wholesaler. Despite the challenge of slow purchasing power of customers and inadequate capital, he is a hardworking father who wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 45 years old, married to Lucy and blessed with three children aged between ten and 20 years old. He runs a veterinary shop where he sells a variety of animal medicines to his customers who are mostly livestock traders. Antony has been in this business for the past year in the Narok area, earning a monthly income of KES. 30,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD and plans to purchase additional medicines to sell as this will boost his purchasing power.

He intends to use the profits gained to reinvest and grow the business. His future plan is to become a large-scale outlet.

loans.use: to purchase animal medicines.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Salvador con su credikiva compró insumos y elaboró deliciosos postres que vendió rápidamente, su crédito fue muy oportuno porque lo hizo en una temporada de gran movimiento comercial, que le facilitó aumentar la producción y comprar mil etiquetas de su propia marca. Él envía el siguiente mensaje a que sus financiadores: “Estoy infinitamente agradecido por brindarme la oportunidad de mejorar mi negocio. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos de repostería  y  desarrollará un cartel publicitario,  para dar a conocer mucho más el producto, con ello su inversión proyecte un éxito, porque se divulgará su oferta y porque en su experiencia, conoce que esta es una de las épocas de más movimiento  comercial en el mercado.
texts.en:
With his previous loan Salvador bought ingredients and made delicious desserts which sold very quickly. The loan money came at an opportune moment as there was a lot of business during that season which made increasing production easier. He bought a thousand labels bearing the name of his business.

Salvador sends the following message to the donors who support him: “I am extremely grateful for the opportunity to improve my business.”

Now he is seeking another loan which he will use to buy ingredients for pastries and have a billboard made so that people will get to know more about his product. This investment will lead to even more success and make his desserts more widely known. In his experience a lot of business takes place in the current season.

loans.use: buy ingredients for pastries and to have a billboard made

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 41-year-old Alhassan from Moriba town Bo. He is married with four children between the ages of six and 18. His children are currently attending school. He was gardener and started this business from the money he earned through his vegetable garden.

Alhassan runs a used clothing business. He sells jeans, T–shirts and blouses. He has been running this business for 15 years. He works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. His business is his only source of income. At present he is facing a high cost of transportation and price inflation. 

Alhassan has requested a loan in order to buy more clothes to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and take good care of his family. In the future, he plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more jeans, T–shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is 26 years old, and married with two children. She earns a living through her food-vending business, selling dumplings and fried potatoes. She has only six months of experience but has already acquired knowledge of the market and needs of clients.

The food products she sells are in high demand. Mwatime applied for a 20,000 KES loan in order to purchase more sacks of raw potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, and baking powder. This will be her first loan with Yehu and she promises to be punctual in repaying it.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of raw potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, and baking powder.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia, tiene tres hijos, él administra una tienda y una panadería, con esto logra cubrir los gastos de su familia, tiene 11 años de tener el negocio, lo inicio con su esposa y juntos lo atienden de lunes a sábado.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta básica, arroz, aceite, jabón, detergentes, y otra variedad para poder ofrecer lo suficiente a los clientes.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, aumentar la clientela, que su condición económica crezca y que su familia cuente con lo necesario.
texts.en:
36-year-old Nelson lives in his own home and has three children. For eleven years he has been running a store and bakery which enables him to cover his family's expenses.  He and his wife started the business together and they both work in it from Monday through Saturday.  

Nelson is requesting a loan to buy basic household products such as rice, oil, soap, detergents and other goods so that he can offer his customers what they need.  His goals are to strengthen his business, increase his number of customers, improve his financial situation and provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, soap and detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda, bread, snacks, beans and rice

loans.name: Damiran

texts.en:
Mr. Damiran, 51 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working with several business entities on contract for ten years. His main job is to do any repair work, housing work and interior and exterior decoration for contract entities.  His younger daughter sells clothes and goods imported from China to local people.

 Since 2006, he has been building his own house, and 90 percent of the construction work is now completed. Due to finances, he hasn’t finished the interior work, and now wants to finish it as soon as possible. So, he is requesting a loan of 6500000 MNT to purchase construction and insulation materials such as cement, gypsum and glass cotton. 

As a result, the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place due to an insulated and completed house. More importantly, the house will reduce coal usage drastically, which will contribute greatly to the environmental protection cause.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 34 years old and married with no children yet. She runs a store in Moriba town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She has two relatives at home. 

She has been in this business for eight years and sells sugar, milk, mayonnaise, butter and sardines. Her husband helps with the family income through his work as a civil servant. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation issues within her area.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more items like sugar, milk, mayonnaise, butter and sardines. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, milk, mayonnaise, butter and sardines.

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque tiene más facilidades para seguir trabajando, se comprara una vaca con ternero, para mejorar la venta de la leche, esto le ayudara a crecer en su hato ganadero.

El manifiesta que su experiencia con los préstamos es satisfactoria, porque ha podido trabajar la ganadería y los resultados han sido positivos, en su familia su condición es estable, en este periodo ha comprado un medio de transporte para movilizarse, una motocicleta.
texts.en:
Kelvin has decided to apply for a new loan because he has more opportunities in his work. He plans to buy a cow with a calf and sell more milk. This will also help him increase the size of his herd.

In Kelvin’s experience the loans have been very satisfactory because he has been able to continue working with cattle and do well. He and his family are economically stable. He recently bought a motorcycle so he could travel around.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 29-year-old married man, who has been selling fresh chicken since 2010. Abdallah is working hard to expand and improve his business, which is why he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. Abdallah plans to buy a special chicken grill so that he can start selling grilled chicken and chicken sandwiches. He hopes to develop his small shop into an attractive small restaurant, and then into a big one in the future. 
This is Abdallah's second loan cycle from Al Majmoua. His previous loan helped him increase his income and improve his standard of living.
He hopes to be financially stable to ensure that he can provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a special chicken grill.

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es: El banco comunal estrella de belén, está conformado por 10 integrantes, ocho mujeres, dos hombres. Madres y padres de familia con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estos integrantes del banco se caracterizan por ser trabajadores con ganas de superación, el cual han tenido que trabajar duro desde muy joven por falta de recursos económicos y de dicha forma ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Corina Ninoska es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de pago de los integrantes en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de totillas en su casa y de forma ambulante. La rutina de Corina trabajar unas 8 horas diarias  desde las 5: am  que se levanta y prepara las tortillas para salir a venderlas de forma ambulante con una pana de unos 20 kg en su cabeza ofreciendo a los pobladores de su comunidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de materia prima como maíz, leña, gas, cal, bolsas plásticas. El banco comunal Estrella de Belén agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The 'Estrella de Belén' (Star of Bethlehem) community bank has 10 members: 8 women and 2 men.  They are all parents and, between them, they have 20 children in their care.  They are all from Malpaisillo, which is located in the west of the country.  The members of this community bank are noted for being hard-working people who have a desire to improve themselves.  Owing to a lack of financial resources, they have all had to work hard since they were very young in order to help with their household expenses.  

Corina Ninoska is the bank's coordinator and she is responsible for making sure that each member makes their loan repayments on time and in full.  Her own business is making tortillas which she then goes out to sell as an itinerant street vendor, carrying a 20kg basket on her head and selling to people in her community.  Her loan will be used to invest in working capital, stocking her business with raw materials such as corn, firewood, gas, lime and plastic bags. 

The 'Estrella de Belén' community bank are grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua as it helps them to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy raw materials needed for making tortillas such as corn, firewood, gas, lime and plastic bags

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 25 years old and describes herself as a calm, good-natured person who is very responsible regarding her work. She lives with her husband and two children in the suburban area of Likoni.

Habiba works alone in her beauty salon. She has been working in this business for three years, which has allowed her to build up a good customer base. She is asking Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan, so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as dyes, nail polish, scissors, and dryers. 

This investment will help her to improve the presentation of her business and provide a better service to her customers, for which the customers will be very grateful. In this way, she will be able to increase her income. 

Habiba dreams of having a big beauty salon and to even open a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as dyes, nail polish, scissors, and dryers.

loans.name: Isaura Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Isaura, se dedica a la venta de lácteos y una tienda de productos domésticos, tiene 33 años de edad, se dedica a este negocio desde hace un año, vive junto con su esposo y tienen dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, el negocio lo aprendió en un trabajo anteriormente el cual le ayudó para decidir e iniciar su propio negocio, lo atiende de lunes a sábado.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como lácteos, queso, crema, frijoles, arroz, carne, está compra le ayudara para incrementar el negocio, ofrecer a los clientes una mayor variedad.

Su aspiración es fortalecer su actividad comercial, ya que esto le permitirá tener una mejor estabilidad con su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isaura, who is 33, has been selling dairy products and running a household goods shop for a year.  She lives with her husband and their two children who are still at school.  She learned her trade in a previous job which helped her to make the decision to start her own shop where she serves from Monday to Saturday.  She is seeking a loan to buy goods such as dairy products, cheese, cream, beans, rice and meat which will enable her to expand her business and offer her customers greater choice.  Her ambition is to consolidate her business which will provide greater stability for her family and will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, beans, rice and meat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine successfully completed the repayment of her first loan much before the due date, owing it to her increased sales. She is now requesting a second loan of KES 40,000 which she will add up to her savings to help purchase an embroidery sewing machine.
 
She has managed to employ a lady to assist in managing her customers. She hopes to use the increased proceeds to expand her business as well as to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase materials for dressmaking and tailoring

loans.name: Jose William

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de celulares, tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos, los cuales dependen de él, José tiene 5 años de poseer el negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado junto a su esposa quien atiende un local.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de teléfonos celulares de diferentes marcas, tambien comprara cargadores y demás accesorios para la reparación y la venta, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar el negocio.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José's business is selling cell phones.  He is 32 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  José has owned his business for five years.  He works from Monday to Saturday together with his wife who serves customers.

José is requesting a loan to buy different brands of cell phone.  He will also buy chargers and other accessories for repairing and selling phones.  This purchase will help him to increase his business.

José's goal is to strengthen his business and provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, chargers and accessories

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 39 years old, lives with his wife, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people for five consecutive years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Sometimes for a client order, he makes decorations and does some construction work for additional income. Using his previous loan, he has repaired many parts of his house. But still due to miscalculation of costs in the repair of the house, he didn't finish the repairs. So he is again requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as bricks, hardwood floor material, vacuum insulated windows and ceilings. 
As you can see in his photo, the house is still not layered with bricks, and the windows are vulnerable to storms and frost. By giving this client one more loan, he can finish his long-dreamt-of house repair work. The repaired house will certainly help the family in many ways. Just to name few of them: it will provide a comfortable and warm place, allow less consumption of coal as a fuel source, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution, and will increase his enthusiasm for the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as hardwood floor material and vacuum insulated windows

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro, de 41 años  es un hombre serio, trabajador y soltero. Vive en compañía de su mamá Daria y sus 3 hermanos menores a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 8 años.  
Hace 30 años murió su padre, desde entonces tubo que encargarse de su familia, ayudando a su mamá en los gastos del hogar. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura. La siembra de papa, maíz, alverja y habas es su principal actividad. Gusta mucho de cuidar sus sembríos y mantenerlos muy limpios, ya que de esa manera puede mejorar los ingresos económicos, “pues a mejor calidad de alimentos mejor precio obtienes”, comenta muy feliz. Cuenta además que posee animales: una vaca, una ternera, cerdos y ovejas, las cuales cuida en su establo y cuando crecen los comercializa a los carniceros que lo visitan en su misma casa. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias, para poder mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Huaribamba” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con la siembra, razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Alejandro, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para mantener la calidad de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 41 years old, is a serious, hardworking and single man.  He lives with his mother, Daria, and his 3 younger siblings, whom he cares for in the house he bought 8 years ago.  His father passed away 30 years ago, and since then he has had to take care of his family, helping his mother with household expenses.

His primary economic activity is in agriculture.  Sowing potatoes, corn, peas, and broad beans is his primary activity.  He likes taking care of his fields a lot and keeping them very clean, since in this way, he can improve his economic earnings.  "The better the quality of the food, the better price you get," he comments happily.

He also says that he has animals:  a cow, a calf, pigs and sheep, which he cares for in his stable.  When they grow, he sells them to butchers who visits him at his home.

Now he wants to increase his earnings in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.  He belongs to the solidarity group "Huaribamba," and this is his 8th loan with MFP, where he feels happy.  He hopes to get the loan in order to continue sowing, and promises to be punctual with his repayments.

Alejandro will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer in order to maintain the quality of his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to maintain the quality of his plants.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has cleared his previous loan and has now diversified to sheep keeping. He harvested plenty of wheat in the previous season. 

He has applied for a business loan from KADET LTD to purchase farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.

He hopes to grow the business into a large scale venture.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land

loans.name: Chumbani

texts.en:
Chumbani is 24 years of age and lives with her husband, who is employed in a private company, and with their son, who is in school. She is a very responsible, hard-working and kind woman who has her own business, selling cashew nuts at the market.

Chumbani's business is in the municipal market, a location that has its advantages, due to the volume of people who visit the locale daily.She gets her merchandise from farmers in the rural areas and she admits that her job requires a lot of sacrifice since she has to walk through their farms.

Wishing to boost earnings, Chumbani is soliciting a loan from Yehu so she can purchase five sacks of cashew nuts and provide for their transport.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of cashew nuts and provide for their transport.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz  marina de  54 años de edad, madres soltera con  hijos mayores de edad. Es originaria de  Managua lugar que está ubicado en la central de la región. Luz es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir obtener su alimento diario. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos tuvo una  adolescencia y juventud muy trabajada. En sus ratos libre le gusta mucho escuchar música del recuerdo.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace 28 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. La rutina diaria de esta mujer es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que ha sido su forma de vida  y la de su familia. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería  y aprovecha la temporada de la entrada a clases para ofrecer productos como: camisas, camisetas, camisolines, calcetas, medias, ropa interior, faldas, short, mochilas. Luz Marina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 54, is a single mother with adult children.  She's from the city of Managua, located in the central part of the region.  Luz is a hardworking and responsible woman who has had to fight since she was very young to go out and get her daily bread.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, she had an adolescence and youth full of hardships.  In her free time she really likes to listen to oldies.

Thanks to her enterprising spirit and desire to get ahead, she works selling new clothing.  She has made a living in this business for 28 years.  Her business is located in a few of the markets in town.  Her daily routine is to work some 10 hours.  She carries out this job with great pleasure because it has been her way of life and that of her family.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital, to stock her business by buying and selling merchandise, and to take advantage of the beginning of the school year to offer products such as shirts, t-shirts, camisoles, socks, stockings, underwear, skirts, shorts, and backpacks.

Luz Marina is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy clothing and backpacks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and is 30 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to proceed with her studies after primary level due to lack of school fees. She has three children who are in school. Fatuma's work is making and selling dumplings. She began this business after saving a small amount through a merry-go-round business, and up to now she has had six years of experience.

She decided to apply for a loan that will allow her to buy ingredients for making dumplings: wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder. In the future she wants to have a hotel.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making dumplings: wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Mohamed from Kandeh town Bo. He is married with two children, one year and 3 years old. He started this business because he needs to create a permanent source of income to support his children 

Mohamed runs a phone accessories shop; he sells phone chargers, batteries, mobile phones and different kinds of phone accessories. He has been running this business for the past four years. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. At present he is facing with needing a permanent business location.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order to buy mobile phones and different kinds of phone accessories. The extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and increase his capital. In the future, he plans to import his stock from overseas. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and different kinds of phone accessories.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres understands the responsibilities of working independently. A Navy veteran and former realtor, he worked his way into the construction industry after receiving numerous home repair and “fix-up” requests during his eight years as a realtor.

Knowing the majority of requests would be unpaid, he considered a career change and opened One Stop Contractors in his hometown of El Paso. He now employs two to seven people per project.

One Stop Contractors is a general contracting business that does “a little bit of everything,” Andres says. His list of services includes remodeling, painting, and floor repairing. The multiple services offered within the three-year-old business make it unique among others in the El Paso area, Andres says, as his business is not tied to one field of construction. In fact, that ability to work within many general aspects of construction is what inspired him to name his company “One Stop.”

Andres applied for a loan from Accion Texas Inc. after another Accion client (and military veteran) referred him to the nonprofit lender. 

With a pending contract to resurface the outside, change some siding, and paint all three of a seafood restaurant chain in El Paso, Andres says he wouldn’t have been able to close the deal without upfront funds and equipment to complete the project. 

The restaurant is offering Andres and his team a total of $30,000 for their work. Andres hopes the loan will help rebuild credit for the business and gain positive cash flow for future projects. “This loan is going to take me a step forward,” he says proudly.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and secure a project with a major resturant.
