She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to purchase one-day-old broiler chicks and their feed. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her poultry farm, more and more. She hopes to be a chicken meat supplier in Voi, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one-day-old broiler chicks, and their feed.

loans.name: Maria  Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 57 años, no tuvo ningún nivel de instrucción por la escasez de recursos en su hogar, se casó siendo muy joven con Felipe que ahora tiene 63 años y se dedica por cuenta propia a la agricultura, ya no tienen hijos a cargo, pues todos son adultos e independientes. María nació en Chone pero desde hace muchos años vive en el Cantón Santo Domingo de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. María reside en la Parroquia Puerto Limón de este cantón, un sector que fue habitado por una comunidad tsáchila y tiene varios atractivos turísticos, aunque está muy alejado de la ciudad. Además los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Hace 3 años María solo se dedicaba a los quehaceres domésticos, sin embargo, nació en ella la preocupación por su futuro y los años de vejez, por lo que decidió aportar también con el sustento para su hogar vendiendo cerdos y pollos, actividad de la que está pendiente en la mañana y en la tarde y a veces en las noches cuando hay que tener especiales cuidados por las condiciones climáticas. Ahora apostó por si primer crédito el cual lo utilizará en la compra de balanceado e insumos para que sus animales tengan la dieta y los cuidados adecuados que les permite crecer sanos y robustos lo que les hace más apetecibles en el mercado. María ha intentado obtener créditos en varias instituciones y Bancos que lamentablemente se han negado a otorgar el dinero por la dificultad para ir a visitar al cliente a la zona rural bastante alejada en donde vive. Pese a esto María siguió luchando incansable y gracias a la intervención de Kiva en Fundación Alternativa, está feliz porque puede dar el primer paso al crecimiento de su negocio y así mantener un ahorro para casos fortuitos que puedan presentarse en su vejez o en la de su esposo.
texts.en:
María is a 57-year-old woman. She had no schooling because of the scarcity of resources in her home. She got married when she was very young to Felipe who is now 63 and who works for himself in farming. They no longer have dependents since all their children are grown and independent. María was born in Chone but many years ago went to live the Santo Domingo hamlet of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo connects the Sierra Region with the Coastal Region of Ecuador. The city has become a commercial corridor with a number of growing industries, and as proof, there are various entrepreneurial families who some years ago began their own businesses and now are micro-business owners who help generate employment. Studies reveal that the majority of the businesses began out of hands-on experience and have caught on due to the travel of tourists, business persons and travelers from region to region; furthermore, it is the third-most inhabited city in the country. María resides in the Puerto Limón Parish of this hamlet, a place which was inhabited by a tsáchila community and has a number of tourist attractions although it is quite far from the city. In addition, the great majority of the inhabitants of this parish work in crop farming and animal husbandry. 

Three years ago María was devoting herself solely to household tasks. However, concern for her future in later years took hold in her, and so she decided to contribute also to the sustenance of her home selling pigs and chickens, an activity she she tends to in the mornings, afternoons and sometimes at night when special precautions must be taken on account of weather conditions. Now she has applied for her first loan which will be used to purchase commercial feed and supplies so her animals may have the diet and necessary care that would allow them to grow healthy and strong, which makes them more desirable in the marketplace. María has tried to take out loans at various institutions and banks where unfortunately they have refused to grant the money, owing to the difficulty in visiting the client in the highly isolated rural area where she lives. Nevertheless María kept on fighting tirelessly and, thanks to the involvement of Kiva with Fundación Alternativa, she is happy because she can take the first step towards growing her business and so maintain some savings against chance events that might arise in her and her husband's old age.

loans.use: to purchase commercial feed and supplies for raising her animals.

loans.name: Sancha

texts.en:
Sancha is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store, such as Sprite, salt, soft drinks, beer, noodles, and rice. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy items for her store, such as soft drinks, beer, salt, noodles, and rice.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 54 years old, married to Charles, and blessed with two children that she supports. She has been growing tomatoes for the last five years and selling the produce to her customers who normally buy wholesale. Her monthly income is KES 40,000. 

She has applied for her fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and tomato seedlings for better crop yields.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. Her future dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and tomato seedlings.

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Emily is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Yetana Group members. The 14 of them, 10 women and 4 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum. 

Emily first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Emily joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.


Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Emily was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 6 bags per ½ an acre. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Emily’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 7 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a long-standing client of Yehu microfinance. She is married and has two children, and she lives in Tiribe, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a hardworking lady who owns a dried fish business, where she buys in large quantities and resells in small quantities at a higher price, as it is in retail.
 
Halima is a person who has a desire to make progress and get ahead in life. She always works hard so that she can provide her family with everything they need. Her dream is to have large business premises. She is requesting this loan to buy more dried fish, so that she can continue working towards her dreams. She is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her once again, as she would like to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish in large quantity, to resell at retail in small quantities

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Upendo Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of seven women and four men, led by Scolastica, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Scolastica first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2008 Long Rains, and now she is preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Scolastica joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to get the best input prices.

Scolastica described her last year's harvest as good, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Scolastica’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and single. Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

Marilou has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a buy and sell, ready-to-wear clothing business.

Marilou aspires to save and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as snack foods, spices, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 52 years old, a married woman who has five children. She is involved in selling charcoal. She has seven years of experience in this field. 

This is Fatuma's first loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her goods turnover and buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Fatuma expresses her gratitude to Yehu and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Arvelodi

texts.en:
Arvelodi lives in the small town of Rustavi. He is 64 years old and a pensioner. He lives with his wife and 12-year-old grandchild. Arvelodi is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the monthly retirement pensions of Arvelodi and his wife. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the 'vulnerable poor' category.

Arvelodi used to work as a taxi driver with his own car, but his business was stopped because of financial problems. Arvelodi sold his car, but now he decided to restart his business, because their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan programme aims to provide business start-up and restart-up loans with more favourable conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to standard credit, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income.

Arvelodi purchased a different car, but he needs money to pay the toll for it. After the tax is paid he will offer a service to local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions. The family will also have enough income to use the usual sources of credit in the country, in case of need.

loans.use: to pay the tax for his car, so he will be able to begin using it to provide taxi services

loans.name: Fundadores De Fe Group

texts.es:
Este BC se llama “Fundadores de FE” lo constituyen 18 emprendedores quienes tienen como principal rubro el turismo, tales como hospedajes, alimentación, artesanía entre otros, todos pertenecen a la ciudad de Pucón.
Yesica Soto, quien en la foto aparece de pie, la primera de derecha a izquierda, luciendo un sombrero mexicano; ofrece el servicio de festejos de cumpleaños, arrienda un local en pleno centro, la cual lo tiene ornamentado para los eventos, fabrica piñatas, coronas, adornos,; además comercializa juguetes en el mismo local.  Se dedica a este rubro desde hace un año y medio; teniendo eventos todos los fines de semana en la temporada de otoño e invierno. 
Yesica invirtió su crédito en mano de obra y materiales para hacer cotillón.
Su sueño es ampliar su rubro a nivel nacional, ya que nos cuenta que por su zona no existe otro servicio como el que ella ofrece. Tiene clientes de otras comunas, por lo cual esta motivada a salir adelante y crecer como empresaria y persona. Es soltera y vive con sus padres 
Por último nos cuenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda  trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, lo que más le gusta son los cursos que ha realizado y recibe apoyo y motivaciones por parte de Fondo Esperanza.
Pucón es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Villarrica. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Fundadores de FE” and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in tourism areas such as hospitality, food, arts and crafts, and other things.  All of them live in Pucón.

Yesica Soto, who is standing to the left in the photograph, wearing a Mexican hat, offers birthday party services.  She rents an establishment downtown where she makes piñatas, crowns, and decorations.  She also sells toys from the same location.  She’s been doing this for a year and a half and has events every weekend in the fall and summer.

Yesica used her loan to pay for labor and supplies to make party favors.

She also tells us that working with Fondo Esperanza has been a great help.  What she likes the most are the courses she took and that she receives help and encouragement.  Pucón is a community in southern Chile, located in the La Araucanía region.  It’s a small town and has all the basic services and tourism.  It’s one of the main mountainous centers in the area and a main tourist center in the region, along with Villarrica.  During the summer months they host various cultural, art, and sporting events.  There are also many ecotourism, adventure tourism, and ethnic tourism.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Anne is a member of Umoja B Group, in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 5 men. Anne is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Anne joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains season of 2010, and now she is enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Anne joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and use her increased profit to send her children to school.

Anne described her last year's harvest as poor, but she believes she can have a better one this year. She hopes that her profit from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to purchase a piece of land and invest in livestock.

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Anne’s group will receive 8.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Selim

texts.en:
Selim is a married man, aged 27 years and blessed with two children, aged four and two years.  He offers motorcycle transportation services in Kapsabet. He has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 14,000.

He has joined KADET LTD through a self-help group. Now he is seeking a first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow, which will be a secondary source of income for him.  

The profits he earns will be used to expand his motorcycle business and purchase another motorbike.  He hopes for prosperity in his business and to educate his children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, to have a second source of income.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 42 years old. He lives in Akhmeta District with his wife, Soso, and his 72-year-old father-in-law. Zurab requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is trading in used clothing. His wife buys used clothing from the wholesalers, and sells at a higher price. It is hardly enough to have food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to Georgia's poor people, who do not qualify for regular credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Zurab will purchase a natural gas apparatus for his car. He plans to serve local people as a taxi driver. Because other kinds of fuel cost much more, Zurab prefers to decrease his costs by adapting his car to run on natural gas. The new taxi business will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for having his car adapted to run on natural gas instead of petrol, reducing his costs.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a 37-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 15, while the youngest is 6 years old. Bebelyn raises pigs. She has been in the hog-raising business for five years. Her husband is a driver. She earns 6,000 PHP a month by doing the hog-raising.

Bebelyn requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and supplements for pigs. Bebelyn would like to expand her business in the future, to support her family and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and nutritional supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: Lisset

texts.es: Lisset  de 38 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde tiene una tienda de víveres, ranchos y refrescos  desde hace 10 años, cuando ahorraron compraron un lote y lo adecuaron para instalar su negocio, mediante el cual ella realiza sus ventas todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, usando  unidades de medidas, que responden a la demanda de su clientela que compra en pequeñas cantidades, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades económicas, en una frecuencia diaria. Para Lisset que su tienda tenga un buen surtido y atender con excelencia a su clientela se ha convertido en su meta principal, porque quiere que su negocio sea la mejor tienda del sector, pero su gran desafío es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará enlatados, víveres, refrescos tubérculos, verduras etc. Su credikiva proyecta ser una buena inversión, pues ella comprará los artículos de mayor rotación para tener siempre inventarios que la ayuden a consolidarse, porque allí su clientela satisface sus necesidades, deseos e intereses de consumo.
texts.en:
Lisset  is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of Malambo where she has store selling basic goods, meals and refreshments for ten years. They saved and bought a plot of land to set up their business. She works here everyday making sales from 7 am until 9 pm to sell to her customers in small quantities using her measuring units. On a daily basis she does what she can with the economic opportunities.

Lisset's main goal has become to have a well stocked store with excellent customer service. She wants her business to be the best store in the area. Her greatest challenge has been not having enough capital to achieve her goal. This is her reason for requesting a Kiva loan, with which she will buy canned goods, basic needs, refreshments, tubers, vegetables, etc. She projects that her loan will be a good investment because she will buy goods that are always in demand so that she is always well stocked, helping her to consolidate. Here, her clients satisfy their needs, desires and consumption habits.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, basic needs, refreshments, tubers, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is now 37 years old. His shop has grown tremendously and he is requesting his fourth loan to purchase more varieties of stock ranging from food stuffs and non-food items such as motorcycle spare parts for easy access by the riders in the area. 

He plans to diversify his retail business more and more with the anticipated profit and make it a one-stop shop. He hopes to grow bigger in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, washing powders, maize flour and rice as well as non-food items.

loans.name: Kasyula

texts.en:
Kasyula, 32, is married, has three children and lives with them in Mwambalazi, province of Coast. She sells fruits and vegetables for a living and also does farming.
She is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapples, bananas, kale, onions, cabbage, and oranges. Her goal is to have several businesses. The challenge she is up against is the high price of the products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, such as pineapples, bananas, kale, onions, cabbage, and oranges.
